intro: Polylepis sacra, commonly known as the sacred polylepis, is a unique tree species native to the Andean highlands of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray bark and conical crown, which helps it withstand harsh mountain conditions. The plant belongs to the Rosaceae family and is adapted to high-altitude environments with low oxygen levels. Polylepis sacra plays a vital role in its ecosystem, providing habitat for various endemic species. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is classified as endangered, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
